text: The 1765 English cricket season was the 22nd season following the earliest known codification of the Laws of Cricket. Details have survived of five eleven-a-side matches between significant teams. ==Matches== Five eleven-a- side match between significant teams are known to have taken place.ACS, p.23.Other matches in England 1765, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2019-02-10. *19 August - Surrey v Dartford - Artillery Ground *26 August - Leeds v Sheffield - Chapeltown Moor, near Leeds *5 September - Sheffield v Leeds - Sheffield *9 September - Chertsey v Richmond - Laleham Burway *16 September - Richmond v Chertsey - Richmond Green ==Other events== A notice in the Salisbury Journal on 16 September announced that: The Cricket players of the parish of Portsea (in Hampshire) will play the game of Cricket with any parish in the said County for 20 guineas each match, home and home. It is not known if the challenge was taken up.Buckley. ==References== ==Bibliography== * * ==Further reading== * * * * * * Category:1765 in English cricket Category:English cricket seasons from 1764 to 1786
title: 1765 English cricket season
